name: ITP-045 - Pipe Conection to Main Drain
template name: ITP-045 - Pipe Conection to Main Drain

name: FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Drawings and drawing registers
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
FREQUENCY: Prior to commencing any activity
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS & ITP
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: QMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, ITP
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast materials have been inspected and fit for purpose and free of defects
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed Receival and Inspection Checklist
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Precast Reinforced Concrete Pipes shall comply with requirements of AS 4058
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.619, Cl. 701.04(a), Cl. 701.04(b)(i), Cl. 705.04(d), Cl. 705.11, AS4058, AS4680
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Document review & Site inspection
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Receival & Inspection Checklist, Manufacturer cetificate or accreditation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: An excavation permit must be issued prior to any excavation commencing.
○ Plant and equipment shall be appropriate for the task.
○ Excavation operations shall not disturb areas outside the limit of excavation
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The position of all drainage lines are to be confirmed with the superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Horizontal clearance ( between the walls of trench to the side of pipe shall be 300mm – 600mm for pipes, and 0.5 to 1 times the overall height of the culvert for box culverts. Trench walls to be vertical where practical.
○ > 100mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width < 1500 mm)
○ > 200mm below underside of pipe (for pipe width > 1500 mm)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Provide mass Concrete support around branch pipe minimum 150mm thick. Concrete shall be grade S40 with a maximum water cement ratio of 0.50.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Reinforment in main drain to be cut and formed into collar. Care should be taken to prevent damage to pipe and to enshore opening is kept to a minimum.
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer / Site Foreman, Superintendent

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Where connection cannot be rendered from inside main drain, connection to consists of 300mm long stub to allow rendering from outside. Bonding of new to old concrete shall be sufficent to ensure no cracks or leaks form. Concrete surfaces to be scabbled, cleaned primed with parchem nitobond SBR. All reinforcement without adequite cover to be sealed with epoxy or similar.
2.7 - Place & compact backfill material over pipes

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ordinary earth from excavation which contains no rock fragments compacted in layers no greater than 150mm. Compaction to be minimum 92% modified A.A.S.H.O. using handheld mechanical equipment. Top 100mm to be topsoil and seeded
3.1 - Compaction and moisture content of backfill & bedding material
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Backfill material shall be compactied to a mean density ratio of 92% using standard compactive effort. Bedding material shall be compacted using a compaction plated to refusal.
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
